emrRegistration.text2: Connect to see your patient list and submit

commands.CREATE_A_NOTE: Create a note: Say “Suki, create a note” or tap New Note button in the lower right corner.
commands.DOWNLOAD_MOBILE_APP: Download the mobile app: Use Suki on the go, as a microphone for Suki Windows and more.
commands.GET_HELP: Get help: Say “Suki, help” to learn more about Suki or chat with us.
commands.IMPORT_SCHEDULE: Import your schedule: Say “Suki, show my patients” or click on the Patients icon in the upper right corner to learn how.
commands.INSTALL_SUKI_WINDOWS: Install Suki Windows app: Dictate anywhere and unlock features like transfer note.
commands.PATIENTS_ICON_CLICK: Tap Patients to see your schedule or patient list
commands.TOGGLE_AGENT: Turn Suki badge off and on

gettingStarted.description: Try these actions or voice commands
gettingStarted.heading: Getting Started

forgotPassword.heading: Forgot Password
forgotPassword.message: Please enter your Suki account email address, then check your email to finish resetting your password.
forgotPassword.tip: Check your email for instructions to reset your password. Or contact support@suki.ai

chat.label: Or chat with us.
chat.text: Message us if you cant find what you need above.

download.label: Download Suki.
download.text: Download and access Suki on mobile, Windows, and web here.

find.label: Find answers.
find.text: Check out the Suki Help Center for FAQs & tutorials.

play.label: See an example.
play.text: Watch how Suki can help you create notes.

introScreen2.description: To get started, here’s a brief video that shows how I can help you create a note.

dropdown.description1: A CSV is a text file that can be created and edited using any text editor. More frequently, however, a CSV file is created by exporting (File > Export) a spreadsheet or database in the program that made it.
dropdown.description2: A properly formatted CSV template is provided. Download the CSV templates to add your schedule to your spreadsheet application.
dropdown.description3: Format your CSV to have these column headers in the first row.
dropdown.description4: Drag and drop the CSV file to the drag-and-drop box, or click to browse for a CSV file. You can upload one CSV file at a time.
dropdown.noteContent: Drag and drop the CSV file to the drag-and-drop box, or click to browse for a CSV file. You can upload one CSV file at a time.
dropdown.title: Learn how to set up your CSV file
dropdown.title2: Download a CSV template for importing.
dropdown.title3: Or you can prepare your CSV file.
dropdown.text1: Appointment date defaults to today if left blank.
dropdown.text2: Format dates as mm/dd/yyyy. Format times as hh:mm 24 hour times – for example 14:30.

duplicateMRN.line1: Multiple patients found with same MRN.

invalidLayout.line2: Column order and data layout must match template

maxRowsExceeded.line2: Reduce total records and try again

dropZone.loading: This process can take a moment...
